oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Colt Navy revolver and holster
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This .36 caliber revolver was preferred by cavalrymen for its light weight. This piece was carried by Lt. Benjamin Keys of Co. G, 60th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA from Sullivan County, Tenn. He was captured at the surrender of Vicksburg, MS on July 4, 1863. After the regiment was paroled in exchanged they were sent to East Tennessee and redesignated as mounted infantry. They served in the command of John Crawford Vaughn in the Dept. of East Tenn. and Southwest Virginia until the end of the war.
